head.title: Political Briefing; On the Road Again In North Dakota

hedline.hl1: Political Briefing; On the Road Again In North Dakota

abstract.p: Duane Sand, Republican seeking to unseat Sen Kent Conrad of North Dakota, promises to campaign in every city and town in state that has a post office, all 300 or so of them (S)

block.p: Another update on Duane Sand, the retired Navy man who campaigned across the frozen breadth of North Dakota in January -- on foot -- to call attention to his novice run for the United States Senate.

Not only did he make it and end up with the Republican nomination (to even his surprise), but he is off on another marathon, of sorts, as he chases after the entrenched Democratic incumbent, Kent Conrad.
Another update on Duane Sand, the retired Navy man who campaigned across the frozen breadth of North Dakota in January -- on foot -- to call attention to his novice run for the United States Senate.

Not only did he make it and end up with the Republican nomination (to even his surprise), but he is off on another marathon, of sorts, as he chases after the entrenched Democratic incumbent, Kent Conrad.
Mr. Sand plans to hit every city and town in the state that has a post office -- all 300 or so of them.
No mention of the crossroads that have post offices. Not yet.
